com.fasterxml.util.membuf.impl
Class MemBufferImpl

java.lang.Object
  com.fasterxml.util.membuf.MemBuffer
      com.fasterxml.util.membuf.impl.MemBufferImpl
All Implemented Interfaces:
Closeable
public class MemBufferImpl
extends MemBuffer

Default MemBuffer implementation, which implements buffer using segmented circular buffer, composed of Segments allocated dnua

Access to queue is fully synchronized -- meaning that all methods are synchronized by implementations as necessary, and caller should not need to use external synchronization -- since parts will have to be anyway (updating of stats, pointers), and since all real-world use cases will need some level of synchronization anyway, even with just single producer and consumer. If it turns out that there are bottlenecks that could be avoided with more granular (or external) locking, this design can be revisited.

Note that if instances are discarded, they MUST be closed: finalize() method is not implemented since it is both somewhat unreliable (i.e. should not be counted on) and can add overhead for GC processing.

          Length prefix is between one and five bytes long, to encode int32 as VInt (most-significant-byte first), where last byte is indicated by set sign bit.

Field Detail

_segmentAllocator

protected final SegmentAllocator _segmentAllocator
Object that is used for allocating physical segments, and to whom segments are released after use.

_segmentSize

protected final int _segmentSize
Size of individual segments.

_maxSegmentsForReuse

protected final int _maxSegmentsForReuse
Smallest number of segments to allocate. This defines the smallest physical size of the queue, such that queue will never shrink beyond this setting. Lowest allowed minimum size is 2, since head and tail of the queue must reside on different segments (to allow expansion)

_maxSegmentsToAllocate

protected final int _maxSegmentsToAllocate
Maximum number of segments to allocate. This defines maximum physical size of the queue.

_head

protected Segment _head
Head refers to the segment in which appends are done, which is the last segment allocated. It may be same as _tail. Note that this is the end of the logical chain starting from _tail.

_tail

protected Segment _tail
Tail refers to the segment from which read are done, which is the oldest segment allocated. It may be same as _head. Can be used for traversing all in-use segments.

_usedSegmentsCount

protected int _usedSegmentsCount
Number of segments reachable via linked list starting from _tail

_entryCount

protected int _entryCount
Number of entries stored in this buffer.

_totalPayloadLength

protected long _totalPayloadLength
Number of bytes stored in all appended entries.

_nextEntryLength

protected int _nextEntryLength
Length of the next entry, if known; -1 if not yet known.

_peekedEntry

protected byte[] _peekedEntry
Segment that was peeked, if any. When entries are peeked, a copy of data is store in this property and actual contents are remove as if entry was read normally.

_firstFreeSegment

protected Segment _firstFreeSegment
Most recently released segment that we hold on to for possible reuse. Only up to _maxSegmentsForReuse may be stored for reuse; others will be handed back to the allocator.

_freeSegmentCount

protected int _freeSegmentCount
Number of segments reachable via _firstFreeSegment; less than equal to _maxSegmentsToAllocate.

_lengthPrefixBuffer

protected final byte[] _lengthPrefixBuffer
Length prefix is between one and five bytes long, to encode int32 as VInt (most-significant-byte first), where last byte is indicated by set sign bit.

Constructor Detail

MemBufferImpl

public MemBufferImpl(SegmentAllocator allocator,
                     int minSegmentsToAllocate,
                     int maxSegmentsToAllocate,
                     Segment initialSegments)
Parameters:
allocator - Allocator used for allocating underlying segments
minSegmentsToAllocate - Maximum number of segments to hold on to (for reuse) after being released. Increases minimum memory usage but can improve performance by avoiding unnecessary re-allocation; and also guarantees that buffer always has at least this much storage capacity.
maxSegmentsToAllocate - Maximum number of segments that can be allocated for this buffer: limits maximum capacity and memory usage
initialSegments - Chain of pre-allocated segments, containing _maxSegmentsForReuse segments that are allocated to ensure that there is always specified minimum capacity available

getMaximumAvailableSpace

public long getMaximumAvailableSpace()
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method for checking what would be the maximum available space available for appending more entries. Since there is per-entry overhead (length prefix of at least one and at most five bytes), this is not all available for entries, but gives an approximate idea of that amount.

Specified by:
getMaximumAvailableSpace in class MemBuffer

getNextEntryLength

public int getNextEntryLength()
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method that will check size of the next entry, if buffer has entries; returns size in bytes if there is at least one entry, or -1 if buffer is empty. Note that this method does not remove the entry and can be called multiple times, that is, it is fully idempotent.

Specified by:
getNextEntryLength in class MemBuffer

getNextEntry

public byte[] getNextEntry(long timeoutMsecs)
                    throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method to get (and remove) next entry from the buffer, if one is available. If buffer is empty, may wait up to specified amount of time for new data to arrive.

Specified by:
getNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Parameters:
timeoutMsecs - Amount of time to wait for more data if buffer is empty, if non-zero positive number; if zero or negative number, will return immediately
Returns:
Next entry from buffer, if one was available either immediately or before waiting for full timeout; or null if no entry became available
Throws:
InterruptedException

readNextEntry

public int readNextEntry(byte[] buffer,
                         int offset)
                  throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method for reading and removing next available entry from buffer and return length of the entry in bytes, if succesful; or, if buffer does not have enough space, return negative number as error code. If no entry is available, will block to wait for more data.

Specified by:
readNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Parameters:
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
Returns:
Length of the entry (non-negative) if read succeeds; or, negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 bytes, and entry length was 6, would return -6.
Throws:
InterruptedException

readNextEntryIfAvailable

public int readNextEntryIfAvailable(byte[] buffer,
                                    int offset)
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method for reading and removing next available entry from buffer and return length of the entry in bytes, if successful; or, if buffer does not have enough space, return negative number as error code. If no entry is available, will return Integer.MIN_VALUE.

Specified by:
readNextEntryIfAvailable in class MemBuffer
Parameters:
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
Returns:
Integer.MIN_VALUE if no entry was available, length of the entry (non-negative) read if read succeeds, or negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 bytes, and entry length was 6, would return -6.

readNextEntry

public int readNextEntry(long timeoutMsecs,
                         byte[] buffer,
                         int offset)
                  throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method for reading and removing next entry from the buffer, if one is available. If buffer is empty, may wait up to specified amount of time for new data to arrive. If no entry is available after timeout, will return Integer.MIN_VALUE. If length of entry exceeds available buffer space, will return negative number that indicates length of the entry that would have been copied.

Specified by:
readNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Parameters:
timeoutMsecs - Amount of time to wait for more data if buffer is empty, if non-zero positive number; if zero or negative number, will return immediately
buffer - Buffer in which entry is to be read: must have enough space for read to succeed
offset - Offset in buffer to use for storing results
Returns:
Integer.MIN_VALUE if no entry was available, length of the entry (non-negative) read if read succeeds, or negative number that indicates length of the entry in case of failures: for example, if buffer only had space for 4 bytes, and entry length was 6, would return -6.
Throws:
InterruptedException

skipNextEntry

public int skipNextEntry()
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method that will skip the next entry from the buffer, if an entry is available, and return length of the skipped entry: if buffer is empty, will return -1

Specified by:
skipNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Returns:
Length of skipped entry, if buffer was not empty; -1 if buffer was empty

peekNextEntry

public byte[] peekNextEntry()
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method that will read, and return (but NOT remove) the next entry, if one is available; or return null if none available. Method is idempotent.

Note that implementations may require additional storage for keeping track of recently peeked entry; for example, they may retain a byte array copy of the contents separate from physical storage.

Specified by:
peekNextEntry in class MemBuffer

waitForNextEntry

public void waitForNextEntry()
                      throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method that can be called to wait until there is at least one entry available for reading.

Note that it is possible to have a race condition if there are multiple readers, such that even if this method returns, following read could fail/block (when another reader thread manages to thread before current thread reads next entry); this method can only be used to guarantee data for single-threaded reads, although it may work as an optimization for multiple reader case as well.

Specified by:
waitForNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Throws:
InterruptedException

waitForNextEntry

public void waitForNextEntry(long maxWaitMsecs)
                      throws InterruptedException
Description copied from class: MemBuffer
Method that can be called to wait until there is at least one entry available for reading; but to only wait up until specified time has elapsed. Note that wait time is lower-bound and actual wait may be longer, depending on things like timer resolution; this depends on how accurately Object.wait(long) limits wait time.

Note that it is possible to have a race condition if there are multiple readers, such that even if this method returns, following read could fail/block (when another reader thread manages to thread before current thread reads next entry); this method can only be used to guarantee data for single-threaded reads, although it may work as an optimization for multiple reader case as well.

Specified by:
waitForNextEntry in class MemBuffer
Throws:
InterruptedException
